programme.desc: In the 1990s, the media dubbed Richard Rogers the 'Last Call Killer' because he targeted men in gay bars who were obviously intoxicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible... and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if he'd signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, college co-ed Jenna Verhaalen was found dead in her Bryan, Texas apartment and petechial hemorrhages in her eyes indicated that she was strangled.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Nevada politician Kathy Augustine died mysteriously during a hard-fought re-election campaign and the medical examiner could neither isolate the cause of death, nor explain the tiny puncture wounds discovered during the autopsy.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college student is reported missing, police believe their investigation will be like countless others. But when they discover blood spatter in her boyfriend's bedroom, they know this case is going to be different.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2001, Ginger Hayes and her infant son Nicholas were abducted during a carjacking and the crime had been reported by a witness within minutes of occurrence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Tracey Frame, 35, was convicted of killing David Nixon in April 2002 after he planned to end their relationship.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Judy Southern arrived home from work and was shot by a gunman waiting within. Her husband Allen arrived shortly afterwards, called 911 to report his wife had been shot and drove her to the hospital.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: They thought the fire would cover their crime. But one tiny clue, no bigger than a thumbtack, remained. It held all the information investigators needed to put a trio of cold-blooded killers behind bars.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 12, 1994, Crystal Perry was viciously murdered in her home in Bridgton, Maine. Michael Hutchinson, 32, was found guilty of murder in the 1994 slaying at Perry's home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Susan Fassett was gunned down as she left church choir practice in Poughkeepsie, NY. Her husband Jeff became the prime suspect, until he was cleared by police, who then suspected to Fred Andros, with whom Susan had her affair.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy socialite died after falling down the stairs, witnesses said one thing and evidence indicated another. To find out what really happened, investigators turned to forensic science, a physicist and an expert in accident reconstruction.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, St. Cloud teenager Jason MacLennan returned home after a night out with friends and discovered his father Ken's body lying in a pool of blood.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A surgeon is stabbed to death, and the most likely suspect is seen in a restaurant at the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors don't know why the young scientist is gravely ill. When tests finally reveal the cause, it's too late to save him. Police hope that lab analysis of his hair, showing when attempts were made on his life and what was used will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman was dead. The man had been shot four times and survived. When the man's version of events was at odds with the evidence, investigators turned to forensic science, hoping to determine if this was a botched robbery, or cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2005, David Castor suffered a slow, agonizing death over a period of days. His wife¾Stacey¾maintained it was suicide, even though it was done with antifreeze.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman had been sexually assaulted, stabbed repeatedly, and left for dead. When someone who fit that description practically turned himself in, police were sure they had their man... until the DNA evidence proved them wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young girl was found dead, police quickly arrested the most likely suspect. But cutting-edge technology from NASA enabled a forensic odonatologist to prove the wrong man was behind bars.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2007, Shamaia Smith disappeared from the strip club she worked at in East Hartford, CT. Police look at various customers of the strip club, but focus on local businessman Kenneth Otto.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the early hours of a morning just before Christmas, a college co-ed was abducted from the parking lot of her apartment. Her body was found later that day; she'd been sexually assaulted and then shot at point blank range.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1995, Palm Beach waitress Denise O'Neill is abducted and murdered. Her neighbor Luis Caballero arouses suspicions by his odd behavior toward TV crews covering the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, young mother Tammy Tatum was found sexually assaulted and murdered in her Longmont, Colorado apartment. Police initially suspected her estranged husband, but did not have enough evidence to charge him and the case went cold.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The driver said he couldn't have hit and killed a pedestrian on a Harrisburg street. The Jeep Grand Cherokee he was leasing around that time had been sold months ago to a buyer in another state.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A wealthy man and his wife were attacked by three masked men outside their luxurious Louisiana home. He was shot dead and she was forced to open their hidden safe. To solve the crime, police would have to find out who knew about the concealed safe.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1997, Kelly Eckart's car was found with her belongings still in it, after working the late shift in Franklin, Indiana. Days later, her body was found in an isolated ravine.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: The twins encounter blogger PEREZ HILTON on the red carpet at a club and SARAH DREW ("Everwood") guest stars as Megan's best friend from Yale, Caryn.

programme.title: Privileged

programme.title: Privileged

programme.title: The Freedom Center
programme.desc: Across centuries of struggle, freedom has carried many meanings, some painful, some powerful. This documentary pulls back the curtain on forgotten stories and surprising truths, leaving one question: what does freedom really look like today, and what might it become tomorrow?

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Ryan hitchhikes from the Hollywood Sign to New Hampshire with no money, no plan, and only the kindness of strangers. Breakdown drama, surprising true fans, and unforgettable highway heroes turn this wild idea into something deeply human.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: To Grandma's House we go! Chefs Mike Boggs and Nancy Longo face off, cooking up their favorite family recipes, but can they remember how Grandma used to make it?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Hang with a viral sensation in his taxidermy workshop. Watch a bakery turn into a Burmese restaurant. Load up a picnic basket with chicken and ‘dippity dips.’ Drink all the wines, and then sip on what a local calls a ‘sober-up beer.’

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Widowed At 19
programme.desc: Two high school sweethearts had their love story cut too short.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Ross and Rocky Lynch from The Driver Era and share an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Orlando.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: There's nothing like a good sandwich. From smoked salmon, to build-your-own burgers, Baltimore's handhelds game is on point.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: It's the war on I-4! In a clash of the traditional and the experimental, The Milk District takes on Lake Buena Vista. Will Chef Ian Russell of Smoke & Donuts bring the heat or will Chef Norberto of El Patron smoke the competition?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Grab your picnic basket! Chef Ravin Patel and Chef Salvador Gutierrez are about to go head-to-head, attempting to serve up the perfect picnic dishes in the “City of Trees.”

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Ross and Rocky Lynch from The Driver Era and share an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Orlando.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day head to Bloomfield for a rousing game of dek hockey, an education in cheese, and an intro to glass art. The guys finish their day at a “slappers and bangers” party.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Embark on an action-packed Milwaukee adventure with Judge Katie Kegel and Greg! Watch them build a bike, dig into a mission-driven community garden, cook authentic German dishes, and cheer on a thrilling pro bike race. Don't miss the excitement!

programme.title: The Long Road Home
programme.desc: In the aftermath of Hurricane Helene, the communities of Western North Carolina were forever changed. "The Long Road Home" is a WXII 12 original documentary that captures powerful stories of loss, hope, and recovery.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A beloved University of Kentucky football player is murdered on the porch of his house during his 21st birthday party in an assassination-style killing. What leads to the shooter's capture is equally shocking.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Only In

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: It's cuteness overload at a rescue farm for disabled animals and Justin's donation makes a huge difference. The guys roll out trivia bowling for Winston-Salem locals, sparking tons of laughs. Jimmy Luv kindly hides cash for lucky strangers to find.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find a Neurodiverse Universe, a sidewalk juggling optimist, and free fresh veggies? The same place where pollinators are prioritized and where records get their grooves.

programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: As flames from the deadly 2017 Tubbs Fire tore through Santa Rosa, a first-time mother went into labor, while families fled with moments to spare… before making the powerful choice to return.
